p: In the context of HIV, it has been shown that selective MOR agonists such as endomorphin-1, but not DAMGO or morphine, significantly increase HIV-1 replication in infected microglia (Peterson et al. 1999). This effect might be due to an apparent bias of endomorphin-1 towards arrestin recruitment and receptor phosphorylation, which was significantly correlated with agonist-induced internalization of MOR (McPherson et al. 2010). It is suggested that ligands that display bias towards G protein-mediated pathways and away from Î²-arrestin 2 recruitment may have improved therapeutic profiles against the development of tolerance and dependence/addiction (McPherson et al. 2010).
